title: How to Use Lemon Curd

steps.headline: Mix lemon curd into your your oatmeal or chia pudding.
steps.description: Lemon curd can give your breakfast a delicious hint of fruity tartness. Add a spoonful to your breakfast oatmeal or chia pudding and mix it well. Toss a handful of blueberries or sliced strawberries on top and dig in. Sprinkle flaxseed on top to add a nutty dose of fiber to your morning meal.

steps.headline: Spread it on an English muffin or toast.
steps.description: If you’re in a hurry, a spoonful of lemon curd can quickly liven up your morning toast, scone, or English muffin. It also makes a tasty replacement for butter without adding a lot of calories and fat to your breakfast. Spread the lemon curd on as thick as you like! Try using a complementary fruit jam, like strawberry or blueberry, along with the lemon curd to create tasty combinations.

steps.headline: Add a dollop to your pancake or waffle.
steps.description: Lemon curd can give your short stack a delicious tang without piling on the calories. It’s so flavorful, you can even skip the butter and maple syrup. Add a spoonful to your pancake or waffle, spread it evenly, and enjoy! Warm up the lemon curd in the microwave for about 10 seconds first if you want to drizzle it on top like syrup.

steps.headline: Spread it on graham crackers for a sweet treat.
steps.description: The flavor of lemon curd marries very well with graham crackers, but you can also use plain crackers. Spread the curd on as thickly as you want and enjoy your afternoon snack. Spread on fresh cream or cream cheese along with the lemon curd to add some richness to your snack. Add a few banana slices on top for another healthy dose of fruit.

steps.headline: Spoon it over a bowl of fresh berries for a healthy snack.
steps.description: Fill a bowl with one or more of your favorite berries – strawberries, blueberries, blackberries, and raspberries are all delicious choices. Add a spoonful of lemon curd on top. Finish it off with a dollop of light whipped cream or cream cheese. Toss in a handful of banana slices for good measure! Sprinkle chopped pecans or walnuts on top for added crunch.

steps.headline: Mix a spoonful of lemon curd into your favorite yogurt.
steps.description: Use lemon curd to jazz up plain yogurt. You can also try mixing it into complementary yogurt flavors like strawberry or banana to create interesting flavor combinations. Toss a handful of granola on top and dig in. Rich, creamy Greek yogurt is an excellent candidate for lemon curd.

steps.headline: Enhance the flavor of ice cream or frozen yogurt with lemon curd.
steps.description: Lemon curd is delicious with vanilla ice cream, but you can also try getting a little adventurous! Experiment by adding it to ice cream and fro-yo flavors like chocolate fudge, black cherry, and banana nut. Drizzle lemon curd on top of an ice cream sundae to add a lemony kick.

steps.headline: Use lemon curd as icing on your favorite cake.
steps.description: You can try this on any kind of cake you want! If you’re looking for inspiration, lemon curd would pair well with pound cake and vanilla cake. Heat it up for about 10 seconds in the microwave first to make it easily spreadable. You can also just drizzle it on top of the cake!

steps.headline: Replace the chocolate sauce in S’mores with lemon curd.
steps.description: For a tropical take on this classic dessert, spread lemon curd on one side of a graham cracker. Add marshmallow sauce or cream cheese on top of the graham cracker. Spread lemon curd on another graham cracker, then stack the graham cracker on top of the marshmallow or cream cheese. Enjoy your key-lime S’more!

steps.headline: Use it as a sauce for fruit pizza.
steps.description: Replace cream cheese sauce with tangy lemon curd in your favorite fruit pizza recipe. Smear the curd "sauce" on a crust of graham crackers or baked sugar cookies. Add fresh fruit toppings like strawberry slices, kiwi, pineapple, and blueberries. Dig in!
